contentheadline.headline: Claude de Rouvroy, duc de Saint-Simon

contentrichtext.text: '''Claude de Rouvroy, duc de Saint-Simon''' (August 1607 – 3 May 1693), [[France|French]] courtier, was the second son of [[Louis de Rouvroy, duc de Saint-Simon|Louis de Rouvroy]], seigneur du Plessis (died 1643), who had been a warm supporter of [[Henry I, Duke of Guise|Henry of Guise]] and the [[Catholic League (French)|Catholic League]]. ==Biography== With his elder brother Claude de Rouvroy entered the service of [[Louis XIII of France|Louis XIII]] as a page and found instant favour with the king. Named first equerry in March 1627 he became in less than three years captain of the châteaux of St Germain and [[Palace of Versailles|Versailles]], master of the hounds, first gentleman of the bed-chamber, royal councillor and governor of [[Meulan-en-Yvelines|Meulan]] and of [[Blaye]]. On the fall of [[La Rochelle]] he received lands in the vicinity valued at 80,000 livres. About three years later his seigniory of Saint-Simon in Vermandois was erected into a duchy, and he was created a [[peerage of France|peer of France]] .Despite the estrangement of later years, he had a true regard for the King, and brought his son up to revere him as the model of kingship.{{sfn|Chisholm|1911|p=45}} He was at first on good terms with [[Cardinal Richelieu|Richelieu]] and was of service on the [[Day of the Dupes|Day of Dupes]] (11 November 1630). Having suffered disgrace for taking the part of his uncle, the baron of Saint Léger, after the capture of Catelet (15 August 1636), he retired to Blaye. He fought in the campaigns of 1638 and 1639, and after the death of Richelieu returned to court, where he was coldly received by the king (18 February 1643). Thenceforth, with the exception of siding with [[Louis, Grand Condé|Condé]] during the [[Fronde]], he took small part in politics. By his first wife, Diane de Budos de Portes, a relative of Condé, whom he married in 1644 and who died in 1670, he had three daughters. By his second wife, Charlotte de l'Aubespine, whom he married in 1672, he had a son [[Louis de Rouvroy, duc de Saint-Simon|Louis]], the "author of the memoirs".{{sfn|Chisholm|1911|p=45}} ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== ;Attribution *{{1911|wstitle=Saint-Simon, Claude de Rouvroy, Duc de |volume=24 |page=45 |url=http://archive.org/stream/encyclopaediabri24chisrich#page/45/mode/1up}} {{Authority control|VIAF=72977129}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Saint-Simon, Claude de Rouvroy, duc de | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French noble | DATE OF BIRTH = 1607 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 3 May 1693 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Saint-Simon, Claude de Rouvroy, duc de}} [[Category:1607 births]] [[Category:1693 deaths]] [[Category:Dukes of France]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Holy Spirit]]
